Amos Silent Voices Tanakh

Chapters

  • Amos 1
  • Amos 2
  • Amos 3
  • Amos 4
  • Amos 5
  • Amos 6
  • Amos 7
  • Amos 8
  • Amos 9
1 I saw the Domina standing beside the altar; and She said: Smite the capitals, that the posts may shake; and break them in pieces on the head of all of them; and I will slay the residue of them with the sword; there shall not one of them flee away, and there shall not one of them escape. 2 Though they dig into the nether-world, thence shall My hand take them; and though they climb up to heaven, thence will I bring them down. 3 And though they hide themselves in the top of Carmel, I will search and take them out thence; and though they be hid from My sight in the bottom of the sea, thence will I command the serpent, and she shall bite them. 4 And though they go into captivity before their enemies, thence will I command the sword, and it shall slay them; and I will set Mine eyes upon them for evil, and not for good. 5 For the Domina, the GOD of hosts, is She that toucheth the land and it melteth, and all that dwell therein mourn; and it riseth up wholly like the River, and sinketh again, like the River of Egypt; 6 It is She that buildeth Her upper chambers in the heaven, and hath founded Her vault upon the earth; She that calleth for the waters of the sea, and poureth them out upon the face of the earth; The Domina is Her name. 7 Are ye not as the children of the Ethiopians unto Me, O children of Israel? saith the Domina. Have not I brought up Israel out of the land of Egypt, and the Philistines from Caphtor, and Aram from Kir?
8 Behold, the eyes of the Domina GOD are upon the sinful kingdom, and I will destroy it from off the face of the earth; saving that I will not utterly destroy the house of Jacoba, saith the Domina. 9 For, lo, I will command, and I will sift the house of Israel among all the nations, like as corn is sifted in a sieve, yet shall not the least grain fall upon the earth. 10 All the sinners of My people shall die by the sword, that say: 'The evil shall not overtake nor confront us.' 11 In that day will I raise up the tabernacle of David that is fallen, and close up the breaches thereof, and I will raise up her ruins, and I will build it as in the days of old; 12 That they may possess the remnant of Edom, and all the nations, upon whom My name is called, saith the Domina that doeth this.

 13 Behold, the days come, saith the Domina, that the plowman shall overtake the reaper, and the treader of grapes her that soweth seed; and the mountains shall drop sweet wine, and all the hills shall melt. 14 And I will turn the captivity of My people Israel, and they shall build the waste cities, and inhabit them; and they shall plant vineyards, and drink the wine thereof; they shall also make gardens, and eat the fruit of them.
